name: Cozumel Palace

reviews.title: Loved the Palace!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Cozumel Palace Feb. 10-16, '07. This is the first time we have stayed at an all inlcusive hotel and the first time staying on the island. We did stop there on a cruise a few years ago. We were greeted with champagne when we arrived. The room wasn't ready for us because we were so early, so they gave us a pager and we waited in the lobby. It was raining at that point, so the lobby was crowded with all of the hotel and pool guests, but that wasn't problem. We were immediately greeted by another person that informed us of the activities that had been moved insided due to the rain. Within an hour our room was ready. We were upgraded to a larger room due to the volume of people at the hotel. The room was clean and wonderful. The only bad part about that room was the echoing from the hallway. We heard every door slam and every conversation up and down the hall since we were at the end. Bring a sound machine if you are in the hall with the double story rooms. That was the ONLY thing we could find that was a negative about our stay. The whole hotel was nice. The pool was excellent; the location is perfect! The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to downtown and all the shopping. Their version of a Wal-Mart is right across the street in case you need more sunblock, something from the pharmacy, or food, etc. We rented a Jeep from the hotel and took a drive to see the rest of the island on our last full day there. I loved the fact that we didn't have to worry about the water. All the water is purified and food is prepared with this water. That's probably the only reason we have not vacationed in Mexico before; I was concerned about getting sick. No problems here. I would definately stay here and other Palace resorts again after this experience. The staff was very friendly. They bent over backwards to see that we had everything we needed. Our idea of a vacation is being in the sun by the pool and having tropical drinks brought to us all day. That's exactly what we got here. If you want a beach, rent a car and head south and you will discover the most beautiful, white, private beaches on the island. You will be able to snorkel there and at the Chankunaab park. We tried to snorkel in front of the hotel, but it was just too rough for me and not much to see.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great vacation in Cozumel and the Palace was the right place to stay. It was just too short. I live for vacations!
reviews.title: It's a Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Cozumel for the 1st time in January 2007 and this hotel was great. We are from Toronto, Canada and this hotel ranks up there with some of the nicest hotels in our city. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to have a relaxing time with excellent service and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Loved the pampering

likes.liked: — The upgrade to the honeymoon suite, Huge balcony, 3 bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Cozumel and the first time to a Palace Resort. Both did not dissappoint us. We had a tight connection getting to Cozumel and although we made it ,our bags didn't. Once we checked into the Palace, they were so sensitive to our set back of no luggage, they suprised us by upgrading our room to the honeymoon suite. What a room. We have traveled thru out the caribbean and love the beaches of Aruba and Punta Cana, but did not have the accomodations that the Palace offered. The cleanliness and comfort of the room, the great staff, and the atmosphere of the resort are all reasons to give this a thumbs up. Some people say that since they don't spend their vacation in the room, its not important, but for us it matters. We don't spend a lot of time in the room, but when we are in there we like the comforts of home. A king size bed (like at home), clean spacious rooms (like home), and surrounded by smiles and people that want to make your visit and experience a memorable one. Only wish they had a beach to take a walk on.
reviews.title: I would definitely return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We knew this in advance so it was not a suprise, but thats the only thing this resort is lacking.
reviews.title: Darn Good Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We returned from ten fabulous days at the Cozumel Palace on February 5. Everything about this place is great. The service is unbeatable, the food was very good, and the rooms spotless. I truly believe no is not in their vocabulary. We ordered special drinks and and once they understood what you wanted it was never a problem. The snorkeling was very good right off the property and we also took the glass bottom boat tour which was neat, although we didn't see much more than what you could see right from the property. They put on a great spread for Super Bowl complete with munchies, cheerleaders and a pool. The only complaint I would have is that the lobby bar area gets quite smokey in the evening.
reviews.title: Great Time at the Coz Palace
No beach. No peace. No privacy. No thank you.
reviews.text: We chose to travel to Cozumel because of the extraordinary beaches, snorkeling and small-scale appeal of the island. We hoped to find some peace and quiet. Some romance. Some privacy. Some fun.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Instead, we found the Palace.
reviews.title: Overall very good!
The best honeymoon ever!!
reviews.text: I guess if your priority in Mexico is to drink all day long without worrying about your bar tab, then the Palace would be a good place to be. It was really the only reason I could imagine wanting to be there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - No beach - how did I miss this information on the Palace web site?? Instead, 100s of poolside chairs that were crowded together like they were on the deck of a cruise ship
reviews.title: What A Great Way To Celebrate Our First Wedding Anniversary!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The room with a fabulous view

reviews.title: Good but not the best.
reviews.text: We had a 3 day stay at the CP and I'd have to say that was enough. The hotel staff is very friendly and attentive. They even packed a to go lunch for us to take to the airport (which after a 4 hour delay was greatly appreciated).

reviews.title: A liitle under par for this level of all-inclusive
reviews.text: PROS:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - walking distance to downtown, only 10min from airport.
reviews.title: Off a bit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food- the food was just ok, breakfast was fairly good, there are only limited options for lunch. Dinner was only good at the italian restaurant. We both love sushi and chinese food, so this place ranked as terrible. DO NOT eat the sushi or even eat at the asian place unless you want watery stir fry.
reviews.title: Nothing short of excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service
reviews.title: Guest beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed May 16th for a week. A little wierd downtown as there were no cruise ships because of the threat of flu (nowhere on the island). But that made for no crowds downtown--hooray!
reviews.title: Best all incusive in Cozumel by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at the El Cozemuleno and Fiesta American Dive Resort in previous years (prior to the hurricane, after which everything was remodeled everywhere). Not only is this a cut above in the luxury rooms and amenities, but the staff is truly outsdanding. If you say thank you for something they bring you, they say "my pleasure". Now after a week, you've heard that before, so it's trained into them, but they seem genuine about it. They know you by name and face and always greet you.
reviews.title: one night in heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is much better than any other all inclusive. While it's buffet for breakfast and lunch, at dinner it's a choice every night of Italian, Mexican, Oriental, or poolside for barbequed steaks and seafood. Shows in the evening are very good.
reviews.title: Fantastic Honeymoon Spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably not as good as others for kids as their facilities here on the island aren't very large. But for SCUBA divers and snorkelers, this is heaven. Dive shop is great and boat picks you up every morning at 8:30 am. Dives were the usual absolutely wonderful and staff was good. We had a couple of other couples we met while diving that we kept in touch with during our stay. Everyone had a wonderful time, first timers or repeat visitors. We'd recommend this resort in a heartbeat!!!
reviews.title: Romantic & intimate all inclusive resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Norm and Maureen
reviews.title: A great relaxing get-a-way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are frequent visitors to the palace resorts (members), and wanted to add the Cozumel Palace to our list of destinations. Rather than getting into specifics already covered in past reviews, I will just say that the Cozumel Palace was generally on a par with our other palace resort experiences - great food, great service, and great people. The hotel is small compared to other palace properties, but that is to our liking since we get a chance to know the staff. I also targeted this hotel since we have never gone to the area in the summer, and expecting high heat I wanted easy access to ocean swimming to cool off (but temps were not much worse than our Nov and April trips). Although the hotel lacks a sandy beach (aside from the man-made areas on north/south ends), the ability to quickly get into the relatively calm ocean to swim or snorkel was a bonus as it’s just steps from the pool.
reviews.title: Another fine Palace Resort
Beautiful hotel, but don't forget your earplugs.
reviews.text: Here are a few nit picks on the resort. The restaurants seemed somewhat drab in décor and very noisy with the sound bouncing off the walls. Although we thought the food was very good, one exception for me was the fish. Since we seem to overeat way too much on these trips, I often order the fish entree for dinner as an attempt at a lighter meal. I have to say that I did not like a single fish dish this trip, which I tried at the outside grill, the Italian, and the Mexican restaurant. This is contrary to our other palace resort trips. The other dishes were good to excellent. Finding a shaded spot by the pool was not easy if you arrived mid morning, however, the sand patches on the north and south ends always had some chairs under the straw huts available (but service was a bit lacking on the sand). Finally, being on an island the included tour options were pretty skimpy compared to the mainland, and we could not easily day trip to the other palace resorts. That’s ok as the rest of the family doesn’t like to run around as much as I do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the far south end of the hotel which, other than the long walk to get to it, was decent as we overlooked the sand patch and ocean, rather than the pool. Also, I don’t think we were as susceptible to hallway noise with less traffic. We did the included Chankanaab park tour, the included snorkel boat tour from the hotel, and took the included transportation to Mr. Sanchos’s Beach club to do a snorkel boat trip (nothing but taxi fare included for Mr. Sancho’s – ok beach to hang out on, & lots of other activities available to buy). We also did the customary loop drive around the island, and spent a few hours at Punta Sur on another day. Overall, our family of four thoroughly enjoyed the Cozumel Palace and the island of Cozumel in general. I plan on posting a hotel property snorkel video one of these days.
reviews.title: Great all-inclusive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from a week at Cozumel Palace with a friend, and although we found the property beautiful and service to be exceptional, there was one major problem--there is absolutely NO soundproofing between the rooms and the communal hallways. We were in room 430 (a junior suite), and not only was every conversation, footstep, walkie-talkie beep, door slam, squeaky room-service cart, drunken laughter at 2:00 am, and drunken argument at 3:00 am crystal clear, these sounds actually seemed amplified by the acoustics of the enclosed, marble-floored passageways. It was jarring and very disturbing, whether it was maintenance and housekeeping sounds at 7:30 am or the aforementioned middle-of-the-night partying and fighting.
reviews.title: Incredible level of service, but you pay for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As many have said, the service is excellent, the food is great, and the location of the hotel is wonderful. The turquoise water and sunset views were breathtaking. We loved being able to snorkel off the dock and didn't miss not having a beach at all. In fact, we preferred being able to swim and snorkel without sand and sand fleas, ants, etc. Our room was spacious, mattresses and bedding were comfortable, and the bathroom was nice, with a big shower and granite counters. Overall, the value of what we received was superior, with the glaring exception of the noise.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Cozumel Palace was an excellent place to stay. I travelled with my husband, two children and extended family members. All inclusive is the way to go...especially if you have kids that need to eat at odd times like I do. The hotel was really clean and all of the restaurants were good. My kids loved the pool (and the poolside service) and basically spent the majority of the day in it. The service was terrific....although they seemed a bit understaffed and the nightly entertainment was alot of fun! (my daughter still talks about Rico Suave, Brocolli, and Oregano....they were really nice...when we return my husband wants a ping pong rematch with Rico)
reviews.title: Great Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall this was a really nice place to stay that both the kids and adults will enjoy as well!
reviews.title: Best Place I have Ever Stayed! Wonderful Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009
reviews.text: My mother and I booked our vacation because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and my love for the Palace resorts. We are so happy we stayed here. The staff was terrific -- friendly, accomodating, and always smiling. Be sure to chat with Marino (chef), he is great to talk to and will help with any and all requests. Be sure to hang out with Theresa during the day, she and the other members of the entertainment staff are wonderful. I loved chatting with Suegi from the entertainment staff/daycare, she is just a delightful person. The waiters we great especially Francisco, Samuel, and Alberto. I've never stayed at a hotel with better service. Not only was the hotel beautiful and relaxing, but the food was actually great! The gym was very nice. The giftshop had terrific prices. We tried all the restaurants and loved them all. We also did a few exursions on the island, swimming with the dolphins and ATV, and both were wonderful.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place for a Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, we would recommend Cozumel Palace to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation. We are already planning to return later this year.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returning from another week long trip in Cozumel. This was our first time staying at the Cozumel Palace. We generally stay at the Casa Del Mar, so you could imagine our delight with all of the amenities. Don't get me wrong, we LOVE the Casa Del Mar. It has everything we are looking for in a dive trip, but since we had so many people with different tastes in hotels, we opted for the Palace. We were not disappointed in our choice.
reviews.title: Could not have been better in any way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just some comparison feedback versus Playacar Palace...we stayed at the Playacar Palace from Feb 18-23rd and took the ferry over one day to spend some time in Cozumel. Since we could use all facilities being a palace resort guest we got a $3.00 taxi ride to the Cozumel palace (although it's entirely walkable if you're slightly active) from the ferry docks.
reviews.title: Day Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We "beached it" for the morning and middle afternoon on one of the side sanded areas. The water was clear and beautiful midnight blue, but the winds and current were strong - made for some tougher snorkling off the ladders or reef right at the pool area, and I'm used to Atlantic currents of the Northeast US! Coral hurts! But did see some "nemo" type fish, angel fish, a string ray right off of the resort - I'm sure on a calmer day you could even enjoy it more. Great spot for take-off trips to snorkel - they provided a small boat to take you our a bit farther (via signup) and divers were setting off from there in groups.
reviews.title: Not all it's cracked up to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pool area was cramped, and music loud, loud loud! We ate breakfast and lunch at the buffet - it could not compare to Playacar Palace's buffet and choices. There were so many other stations and options, and the quality looked so much better at Playacar (fresher & more bountiful). Especially for lunch - the choices were limited and few in comparison. But the outside grill at lunch looked good - burgers, nachos etc, a better option than the buffett inside if you want to eat by the pool - probably the most spacious area was the outside tables with umbrellas! Seems to me everything was on a smaller, tighter, cramped style than Playacar by far even though they are basically the close in guest occupancy. Drink waitress etc were no where to be found most of the day at the beach areas, so we just went up to the bar ourselves.
reviews.title: Overall experience was very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We talked to several staying guests there and they felt the same that the layout of hotel/rooms/bars etc and restaurants were tight on space, a crowded feel.
reviews.title: Cozumel Palace Feb 15-20
Our perfect vacation
reviews.text: Overall, a place to visit for the day or cool off for a few hours, jump off to snorkel - but I wouldn't want to stay here for a extended time, not for the price - when you have other great choices on the mainland and a ferry ride is so easy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I spent 8 days at CP and loved it. Room was great with a ocean view and top of the line inside. Small bar and well stocked fridge in the room and a big comfortable bed plus a jaccuzi in the living room. What more could you want? The service from the first minute to the last was the best I have ever had in all my travels.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on the edge of town and on the main drag was nice. Everything you want is just a short walk away. Supermarket right across the street and Margaritaville two blocks down the street. But you won't need much of anything with the 4 places to eat at CP. The food was great wherever you want to eat. My favorite was when they set up the grill out by the pool and you just pick from steak, chickien and fish with all the sides setup on the tables for you to get what you want. It was like a cruise ship that didn't move!
reviews.title: Superb service and great accommodations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nightly shows by the pool were good and don't miss the fire show. It was nice that the staff at the end of the shows would always get the kids involved for some fun.
reviews.title: Best Vacation with Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did a ton of diving with Aqua Safari based in the resort (leaving at the end of July) bad move by CP on that one but they will still pick you up for dive trips at CP after that. AS is a good dive operator for sure. Shore dives were pretty nice at CP as well. What a great trip!!! The only complaint I have is the noise in the halls early in the morning, familys with loud kids stomping down the halls on flip-flops headed to breakfast.
reviews.title: Outstanding 5 star dive resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room, the resort lobby and the pool area were top rate. Every employee we encountered provided "world class" service, especially Miguel, Carlos and "Super"
reviews.title: One Place in Paradise, you will never want to leave

description: Not too long ago, Cozumel Island was revealed to the world with all its charm. Now adventure travelers, divers and nature lovers are discovering Cozumel Palace, the stunning resort bathed by the blue waters of the Caribbean Sea. Experience the true meaning of luxury and fun. Enjoy the amenities and attention to detail from the moment you arrive. Our Cozumel Palace will take your breath away!
